JUDGES: Corneliu Bîrsan;Egbert Myjer;Ineta Ziemele;Ján Šikuta;Josep Casadevall;Kristina Pardalos;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant , PERSON . , is an unlimited liability company established under the laws of GPE with its head office in ORG . It was represented before the ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in ORG .
CARDINAL . The Government of GPE ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . NORP The applicant company supplied medical equipment to a hospital , which at that time was owned by and under the responsibility of the State .

CARDINAL . The power of administration over the hospital and its ownership were later transferred by law ( Law no . PERSON . ) to the self - governing region ( samosprávny kraj ) where the hospital is situated .
CARDINAL . NORP The hospital owned premises not used for its main function , which it let to third parties .
CARDINAL . In DATE the hospital ceased paying the applicant , and later acknowledged its debt to the applicant in an amount equivalent to MONEY ( ORG ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company sued the hospital for payment of the above - mentioned amount .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG Okresný súd ) allowed the action and , on DATE , ORG ( Krajský súd ) upheld ORG judgment following an appeal by the defendant . The judgment became final and binding on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company applied for enforcement of the judgment under LAW of DATE ( Law no . PERSON . , as amended ) .

CARDINAL . In DATE the judicial enforcement officer ( exekútor ) decided that the enforcement should be carried out by means of attaching the rent collected by the hospital from the letting of the above - mentioned premises .

CARDINAL . On DATE , by a decision of its council , the ownership of and power of administration over the hospital was taken over by the selfgoverning region , which also assumed the role of landlord in respect of those premises .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Ústavný súd ) declared inadmissible a complaint made by the applicant company under LAW contesting the council ’s decision of DATE on the grounds that it had violated , inter alia , the applicant company ’s right of access to court and to equal treatment in proceedings .
CARDINAL . The Constitutional Court found that there was no indication of an interference with the applicant ’s procedural rights and that the complaint was manifestly ill - founded .

CARDINAL . NORP By letter of CARDINAL DATE the judicial enforcement officer informed the applicant company that the total amount of principal debt plus interest accrued for late payment and costs incurred totalled , at that time , the equivalent of some ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL , of which the equivalent of some EUR CARDINAL had already been obtained from the defendant .

CARDINAL . The judicial enforcement officer also informed the applicant company that the council ’s decision of DATE had made it impossible to continue attaching the rent pertaining to the LOC in question , as these were no longer owned and let by the debtor .

CARDINAL . NORP The judicial enforcement officer further informed the applicant company that using other means of enforcement was not possible due to a temporary immunity from the enforcement of financial claims enjoyed by the hospital under LAW ( Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL Coll . , as amended ) and Section CARDINALa of the Health Care Act ( Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ORG . , as amended ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE , by a decision of its council , the selfgoverning region decided to merge hospitals under its administration into a new entity , an agency named ORG ( PERSON záväzkov a pohľadávok – “ the ORG ” ) , with effect from CARDINAL DATE . The ORG was the legal successor to the hospital in question , and its purpose was to settle obligations and claims related to the functioning of the hospitals in the region . The ORG did not have the status of a health - care establishment and thus did not benefit from the bar to enforcement of claims against such establishments .

CARDINAL . By letter of CARDINAL DATE the enforcement office notified the applicant that the enforcement had been terminated as , on DATE , the applicant ’s entire claim had been settled by the ORG . The applicant company ’s legal costs and penalty interest for the debtor ’s late payment of the principal debt had also been paid .
CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the LAW no . PERSON . , as amended ) provides :

“ CARDINAL . The Constitutional Court shall decide complaints by natural or legal persons alleging a violation of their fundamental rights or freedoms ... unless the protection of such rights and freedoms falls within the jurisdiction of a different court .

CARDINAL . NORP If ORG finds a complaint justified , it shall deliver a decision stating that a person ’s rights or freedoms as set out in paragraph CARDINAL have been violated by a final decision , specific measure or other act and shall quash such decision , measure or act . If the violation that has been found is the result of a failure to act , ORG may order [ the authority ] which has violated the rights or freedoms to take the necessary action . At the same time it may remit the case to the authority concerned for further proceedings , order such authority to refrain from violating the fundamental rights and freedoms ... or , where appropriate , order those who have violated the rights or freedoms set out in paragraph CARDINAL to restore the situation to that existing prior to the violation .
CARDINAL . NORP In its decision on a complaint ORG may grant appropriate financial compensation to the person whose rights under paragraph CARDINAL have been violated . ”

CARDINAL . The statutory bar to the enforcement of financial claims against healthcare establishments was laid down in different pieces of legislation and its duration , always intended to be temporary , was extended several times . The precise scope of the bar also varied over time .

CARDINAL . The bar had its origin in Article CARDINAL of LAW of DATE , such Article being incorporated into the code by PERSON no . PERSON . The bar was , in this implementation , intended to last until DATE .

CARDINAL . Article CARDINAL of the amended Enforcement Code of DATE was repealed by ORG by virtue of its judgment of DATE ( published in LAW under no . CARDINAL ) with effect from DATE . ORG found the bar unconstitutional because it created an unjustified difference between the treatment of healthcare establishments and other debtors .

CARDINAL . With effect from DATE , a new statutory bar to enforcement of financial claims against health - care establishments was introduced into ORG by the operation of Law no . PERSON . In particular , enforcement was not permissible against the financial assets and income of health - care establishments in so far as such monies were allocated for providing and maintaining health care and related services , nor against assets belonging to health - care establishments which were purchased out of funds deriving from the insurance premiums paid by the establishment ’s users and which were indispensable for the running and maintenance of the establishment .

CARDINAL . On DATE a new bar entered into force by virtue of an amendment ( Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL Coll . ) to ORG . It introduced a new section CARDINALa to the code , stated to apply until DATE . Under sub - section CARDINAL ( d ) of that provision , enforcement could not be aimed at attaching the property of health - care establishments obtained via insurance premiums or property to be used for providing health care .

CARDINAL . In DATE a new constitutional challenge to the bar , as it then stood , was brought by a group of Members of ORG . It was accepted by ORG to the extent that , in its ruling of DATE ( published in LAW under no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , it suspended the legal effect of the bar . However , ORG has never ruled on the merits of the bar , as it expired while the constitutional challenge was pending . In its decision of DATE ORG nevertheless made a formal note of its DATE ruling , considering it a part of its case - law .

CARDINAL . The bar was extended for the last time until DATE by the operation of Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL Coll . , which introduced a new section CARDINALc § CARDINAL to ORG ( Law no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL Coll . , as amended ) .
On DATE the bar expired and has ceased to exist with effect from DATE .
